## Overview

Connected Papers is a visual tool for exploring the academic literature landscape. It creates an interactive graph showing papers related to a seed paper, helping researchers discover relevant work and understand the research field structure.

## Key Features

- **Visual Graph Interface**: See relationships between papers in an intuitive network diagram
- **Citation Analysis**: Identify seminal works and derivative papers
- **Prior and Derivative Works**: Distinguish between papers that came before and after your seed paper
- **Similarity Algorithm**: Papers positioned based on bibliographic coupling and co-citation
- **Time Navigation**: View how research has evolved over time
- **Export Capabilities**: Save graphs and lists for future reference

## Use Cases in Research

- Conducting comprehensive literature reviews
- Discovering relevant papers you might have missed
- Understanding the evolution of a research topic
- Identifying key papers and influential authors in a field
- Finding review papers and foundational studies
- Exploring new research directions and related topics

## Getting Started

Visit [connectedpapers.com](https://www.connectedpapers.com) and enter a paper DOI or search for a paper to generate its connection graph.
